name: The Secret Monster Society
description: A classic point-and-click comedy adventure game, set in a unique world of monsters and creatures. Embark on an epic adventure across land and sea, using time travel to stop an evil genius from destroying the world. Inspired by Saturday morning cartoons.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP / Vista / 7 Processor: 1.0 GHz Processor Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 100% DirectX compatible graphics Storage: 1 GB available space Sound Card: 100% DirectX compatible card or onboard sound
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 Processor: 1.5 GHz Processor Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: 100% DirectX compatible graphics Storage: 1 GB available space Sound Card: 100% DirectX compatible card or onboard sound

reviews.review_text: Fun little short chapter, can't wait for the next one! Wish it could have been a little bit longer though, as just when I started having a load of fun, it was over :(

I can only assume that this game was made with small children in mind, because this game is way too easy to take seriously. I got this game as part of a bundle, but would never pay full price for a short game like this.  The premise is good, the art is cute, the interface... is ok (but being unable to click on anything in the upper 3rd of the screen because the inventory bar pops out is really annoying). But by far my biggest gripe is how short this game is, and how most of your time is spent walking back and forth between places.  Fix the bar, make the chapters at minimum 2x longer, add a skip feature (spacebar) to long walks/repeat dialogue, and if this game is intended for small children, please say so.
